Kata Siswi SMP soal Cairan yang Disiram ke Wajah: Dari Campuran Soda Api
07 Nov 2019, 21:33 by Wilda Hayatun Nufus
Jakarta - Polisi masih menyelidiki kandungan kimia yang terdapat pada cairan yang disiramkan kepada AE (13), siswi SMPN 229 Kebon Jeruk. Polisi belum memastikan apakan cairan itu jenis air keras.
"Kata dokternya ini tuh cairan kimia yang dibuat sendiri," kata AE saat ditemui detikcom di rumahnya di Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta Barat, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Menurut dokter, seperti dituturkan kembali oleh AE, cairan kimia itu mengandung soda api.
"Dari campuran soda api sama lelehan lilin yang panas gitu," kata AE.
Beruntung, wajah AE tidak rusak akibat siraman cairan kimia itu. Namun AE masih merasakan panas akibat siraman cairan kimia itu.
"Sama aja kayak aku masih proses penyembuhan," imbuh AE.
AE mengaku kaget atas kejadian itu. Sedangkan dia sendiri merasa tidak pernah bermusuhan dengan orang lain.
"Kaget banget. Aku nggak salah apa-apa terus tiba-tiba disiram air kayak nggak terima gitu," ucapnya.
Kasus itu telah dilaporkan ke polisi. AE berharap polisi segera menangkap pelakunya.
"Semoga (polisi) bisa nemuin pelakunya, jangan hal ini keulang sama orang lain," ucapnya.
Peristiwa itu terjadi pada Selasa (5/11) lalu saat AE dan temannya, P, pulang sekolah. Hingga saat ini AE belum masuk sekolah lagi karena masih merasakan kesakitan akibat siraman cairan kimia itu.

(mea/mea)

Said Junior High School student about Liquid Flushed to the Face: From a Mix of Soda Fire
Nov 7 2019, 21:33 by Wilda Hayatun Nufus
Jakarta - Police are still investigating the chemical content contained in the liquid that was splashed to AE (13), a student at SMP 229 Kebon Jeruk. The police have not confirmed whether the liquid is hard water.
"The doctor said this is a self-made chemical liquid," said AE when met detikcom at his home in Kebon Jeruk, West Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019).
According to doctors, as told back by AE, the chemical liquid contains caustic soda.
"From the mixture of fire soda and hot melt candles," said AE.
Luckily, AE's face was not damaged by the splash of the chemical liquid. But AE still felt the heat due to the splash of the chemical liquid.
"Just like I'm still healing," added AE.
AE claimed to be shocked by the incident. While he himself never felt hostile to others.
"I was so shocked. I didn't do anything wrong when I was suddenly doused with water like I didn't accept it," he said.
The case has been reported to the police. AE hopes the police catch the culprit soon.
"Hopefully (the police) can find the culprit, don't repeat this to other people," he said.
The incident occurred on Tuesday (5/11) and then when AE and her friend, P, came home from school. Until now AE has not entered school anymore because he still feels the pain caused by the splash of the chemical liquid.

(mea / mea)
